stories.original_headline: Scientists sent viruses to space and they evolved in surprising ways
stories.original_summary: When scientists sent bacteria-infecting viruses to the International Space Station, the microbes did not behave the same way they do on Earth. stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards' Sky-Chamber Reveals Strange Evolution of Tiny Magic Sprites!
stories.fantasy_story: The Royal Order of Wizards sent tiny, unseen magic sprites, known to afflict lesser spirits, aboard their Sky-Chamber into the Aether. To their astonishment, these sprites and the spirits they touched behaved quite differently in the high heavens. New enchantments emerged, altering how the tiny magic affected its hosts, a grand mystery for the kingdom's alchemists.

stories.original_headline: You need to listen to the cosmic horror-comedy podcast Welcome to Night Vale
stories.original_summary: It's relatively rare for a podcast to last 14 years, especially a fiction one. In fact, as far as I can tell, Welcome to Night Vale is the longest continually running fiction podcast out there. (Some will argue it's actually We're Alive, but that has taken a few significant breaks between seasons.)
stories.fantasy_headline: Long-Running Enchanted Broadcast of Dread and Jest Delights Kingdom.
stories.fantasy_story: The ancient Guild of Whispering Sages continues to broadcast their enchanted tales across the land. Known as 'Welcome to the Shadow Vale,' these unique spoken sagas blend tales of cosmic dread with hearty jest. For many seasons, it has remained the longest continuously running magical broadcast, captivating listeners throughout the realm with its peculiar charm.

stories.fantasy_headline: Soft-Scroll Guild's New Rune-Patch Prevents Enchanted Viewers from Rest.
stories.fantasy_story: The esteemed Soft-Scroll Guild recently released its newest rune-patch for the Grand Lexicon of the Eleventh Sky. However, this magical update introduced a peculiar glitch that prevented many enchanted viewing mirrors from entering their slumber. Swiftly, the Guild had to issue an emergency counter-enchantment to allow the realm's arcane portals to finally rest.
